intro: Asclepias muhindensis, commonly known as the Muhindensis milkweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is typical of the genus Asclepias. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are erect and can grow up to several meters in height. Asclepias muhindensis plays an important role in local ecosystems, providing food and habitat for native wildlife.
